00037 class tlm_mm_interface {
00038 public:
00039   virtual void free(tlm_generic_payload*) = 0;
00040   virtual ~tlm_mm_interface() {}

00043 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00044 // Classes and helper functions for the extension mechanism
00045 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00046 // Helper function:
00047 inline unsigned int max_num_extensions(bool increment=false)
00048 {
00049     static unsigned int max_num = 0;
00050     if (increment) ++max_num;
00051     return max_num;
00052 }
00053 
00054 // This class can be used for storing pointers to the extension classes, used
00055 // in tlm_generic_payload:
00056 class tlm_extension_base
00057 {
00058 public:
00059     virtual tlm_extension_base* clone() const = 0;
00060     virtual void free() { delete this; }
00061     virtual void copy_from(tlm_extension_base const &) = 0;
00062 protected:
00063     virtual ~tlm_extension_base() {}
00064     static unsigned int register_extension()
00065     {
00066         return (max_num_extensions(true) - 1);
00067     };
00068 };
00069 
00070 // Base class for all extension classes, derive your extension class in
00071 // the following way:
00072 // class my_extension : public tlm_extension<my_extension> { ...
00073 // This triggers proper extension registration during C++ static
00074 // contruction time. my_extension::ID will hold the unique index in the
00075 // tlm_generic_payload::m_extensions array.
00076 template <typename T>
00077 class tlm_extension : public tlm_extension_base
00078 {
00079 public:
00080     virtual tlm_extension_base* clone() const = 0;
00081     virtual void copy_from(tlm_extension_base const &ext) = 0; //{assert(typeid(this)==typeid(ext)); assert(ID === ext.ID); assert(0);}
00082     virtual ~tlm_extension() {}
00083     const static unsigned int ID;
00084 };
00085 
00086 template <typename T>
00087 const
00088 unsigned int tlm_extension<T>::ID = tlm_extension_base::register_extension();
00089 
00090 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00091 // enumeration types
00092 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00093 enum tlm_command {
00094     TLM_READ_COMMAND,
00095     TLM_WRITE_COMMAND,
00096     TLM_IGNORE_COMMAND
00097 };
00098 
00099 enum tlm_response_status {
00100     TLM_OK_RESPONSE = 1,
00101     TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESPONSE = 0,
00102     TLM_GENERIC_ERROR_RESPONSE = -1,
00103     TLM_ADDRESS_ERROR_RESPONSE = -2,
00104     TLM_COMMAND_ERROR_RESPONSE = -3,
00105     TLM_BURST_ERROR_RESPONSE = -4,
00106     TLM_BYTE_ENABLE_ERROR_RESPONSE = -5
00107 };
00108 
00109 #define TLM_BYTE_DISABLED 0x0
00110 #define TLM_BYTE_ENABLED 0xff
00111 
00112 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00113 // The generic payload class:
00114 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00115 class tlm_generic_payload {
00116 
00117 friend class uvm_gp_wrapper_base;
00118 
00119 public:
00120     //---------------
00121     // Constructors
00122     //---------------
00123 
00124     // Default constructor
00125     tlm_generic_payload()
00126         : m_address(0)
00127         , m_command(TLM_IGNORE_COMMAND)
00128         , m_data(0)
00129         , m_length(0)
00130         , m_response_status(TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESPONSE)
00131         , m_dmi(false)
00132         , m_byte_enable(0)
00133         , m_byte_enable_length(0)
00134         , m_streaming_width(0)
00135         , m_extensions(max_num_extensions())
00136         , m_mm(0)
00137         , m_ref_count(0)
00138     {
00139     }
00140 
00141     explicit tlm_generic_payload(tlm_mm_interface* mm)
00142         : m_address(0)
00143         , m_command(TLM_IGNORE_COMMAND)
00144         , m_data(0)
00145         , m_length(0)
00146         , m_response_status(TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESPONSE)
00147         , m_dmi(false)
00148         , m_byte_enable(0)
00149         , m_byte_enable_length(0)
00150         , m_streaming_width(0)
00151         , m_extensions(max_num_extensions())
00152         , m_mm(mm)
00153         , m_ref_count(0)
00154     {
00155     }
00156 
00157     void acquire(){assert(m_mm != 0); m_ref_count++;}
00158     void release(){assert(m_mm != 0); if (--m_ref_count==0) m_mm->free(this);}
00159     int get_ref_count() const {return m_ref_count;}
00160     void set_mm(tlm_mm_interface* mm) { m_mm = mm; }
00161     bool has_mm() const { return m_mm != 0; }
00162 
00163     void reset(){
00164       //should the other members be reset too?
00165       m_extensions.free_entire_cache();
00166     };
00167 
00168 
00169 private:
00170     //disabled copy ctor and assignment operator.
00171     // Copy constructor
00172     tlm_generic_payload(const tlm_generic_payload& x)
00173         : m_address(x.get_address())
00174         , m_command(x.get_command())
00175         , m_data(x.get_data_ptr())
00176         , m_length(x.get_data_length())
00177         , m_response_status(x.get_response_status())
00178         , m_dmi(x.is_dmi_allowed())
00179         , m_byte_enable(x.get_byte_enable_ptr())
00180         , m_byte_enable_length(x.get_byte_enable_length())
00181         , m_streaming_width(x.get_streaming_width())
00182         , m_extensions(max_num_extensions())
00183     {
00184         // copy all extensions
00185         for(unsigned int i=0; i<m_extensions.size(); i++)
00186         {
00187             m_extensions[i] = x.get_extension(i);
00188         }
00189     }
00190 
00191     // Assignment operator
00192     tlm_generic_payload& operator= (const tlm_generic_payload& x)
00193     {
00194         m_command =            x.get_command();
00195         m_address =            x.get_address();
00196         m_data =               x.get_data_ptr();
00197         m_length =             x.get_data_length();
00198         m_response_status =    x.get_response_status();
00199         m_byte_enable =        x.get_byte_enable_ptr();
00200         m_byte_enable_length = x.get_byte_enable_length();
00201         m_streaming_width =    x.get_streaming_width();
00202         m_dmi =                x.is_dmi_allowed();
00203 
00204         // extension copy: all extension arrays must be of equal size by
00205         // construction (i.e. it must either be constructed after C++
00206         // static construction time, or the resize_extensions() method must
00207         // have been called prior to using the object)
00208         for(unsigned int i=0; i<m_extensions.size(); i++)
00209         {
00210             m_extensions[i] = x.get_extension(i);
00211         }
00212         return (*this);
00213     }
00214 public:
00215     // non-virtual deep-copying of the object
00216     void deep_copy_from(const tlm_generic_payload & other)
00217     {
00218         m_command =            other.get_command();
00219         m_address =            other.get_address();
00220         m_length =             other.get_data_length();
00221         m_response_status =    other.get_response_status();
00222         m_byte_enable_length = other.get_byte_enable_length();
00223         m_streaming_width =    other.get_streaming_width();
00224         m_dmi =                other.is_dmi_allowed();
00225 
00226         // deep copy data
00227         // there must be enough space in the target transaction!
00228         if(m_data && other.m_data)
00229         {
00230             memcpy(m_data, other.m_data, m_length);
00231         }
00232         // deep copy byte enables
00233         // there must be enough space in the target transaction!
00234         if(m_byte_enable && other.m_byte_enable)
00235         {
00236             memcpy(m_byte_enable, other.m_byte_enable, m_byte_enable_length);
00237         }
00238         // deep copy extensions (sticky and non-sticky)
00239         for(unsigned int i=0; i<other.m_extensions.size(); i++)
00240         {
00241             if(other.m_extensions[i])
00242             {                       //original has extension i
00243                 if(!m_extensions[i])
00244                 {                   //We don't: clone.
00245                     tlm_extension_base *ext = other.m_extensions[i]->clone();
00246                     if(ext)     //extension may not be clonable.
00247                     {
00248                         if(has_mm())
00249                         {           //mm can take care of removing cloned extensions
00250                             set_auto_extension(i, ext);
00251                         }
00252                         else
00253                         {           // no mm, user will call free_all_extensions().
00254                             set_extension(i, ext);
00255                         }
00256                     }
00257                 }
00258                 else
00259                 {                   //We already have such extension. Copy original over it.
00260                     m_extensions[i]->copy_from(*other.m_extensions[i]);
00261                 }
00262             }
00263         }
00264     }
00265 
00266     // To update the state of the original generic payload from a deep copy
00267     // Assumes that "other" was created from the original by calling deep_copy_from
00268     // Argument use_byte_enable_on_read determines whether to use or ignores byte enables
00269     // when copying back the data array on a read command
00270 
00271     void update_original_from(const tlm_generic_payload & other,
00272                               bool use_byte_enable_on_read = true)
00273     {
00274         // Copy back extensions that are present on the original
00275         update_extensions_from(other);
00276 
00277         // Copy back the response status and DMI hint attributes
00278         m_response_status = other.get_response_status();
00279         m_dmi             = other.is_dmi_allowed();
00280 
00281         // Copy back the data array for a read command only
00282         // deep_copy_from allowed null pointers, and so will we
00283         // We assume the arrays are the same size
00284         // We test for equal pointers in case the original and the copy share the same array
00285 
00286         if(is_read() && m_data && other.m_data && m_data != other.m_data)
00287         {
00288             if (m_byte_enable && use_byte_enable_on_read)
00289             {
00290                 if (m_byte_enable_length == 8 && m_length % 8 == 0 )
00291                 {
00292                     // Optimized implementation copies 64-bit words by masking
00293                     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_length; i += 8)
00294                     {
00295                         typedef sc_dt::uint64* u;
00296                         *reinterpret_cast<u>(&m_data[i]) &= ~*reinterpret_cast<u>(m_byte_enable);
00297                         *reinterpret_cast<u>(&m_data[i]) |= *reinterpret_cast<u>(&other.m_data[i]) &
00298                                                             *reinterpret_cast<u>(m_byte_enable);
00299                     }
00300                 }
00301                 else if (m_byte_enable_length == 4 && m_length % 4 == 0 )
00302                 {
00303                     // Optimized implementation copies 32-bit words by masking
00304                     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_length; i += 4)
00305                     {
00306                         typedef unsigned int* u;
00307                         *reinterpret_cast<u>(&m_data[i]) &= ~*reinterpret_cast<u>(m_byte_enable);
00308                         *reinterpret_cast<u>(&m_data[i]) |= *reinterpret_cast<u>(&other.m_data[i]) &
00309                                                             *reinterpret_cast<u>(m_byte_enable);
00310                     }
00311                 }
00312                 else
00313                     // Unoptimized implementation
00314                     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_length; i++)
00315                         if ( m_byte_enable[i % m_byte_enable_length] )
00316                             m_data[i] = other.m_data[i];
00317             }
00318             else
00319               memcpy(m_data, other.m_data, m_length);
00320         }
00321     }
00322 
00323     void update_extensions_from(const tlm_generic_payload & other)
00324     {
00325         // deep copy extensions that are already present
00326         for(unsigned int i=0; i<other.m_extensions.size(); i++)
00327         {
00328             if(other.m_extensions[i])
00329             {                       //original has extension i
00330                 if(m_extensions[i])
00331                 {                   //We have it too. copy.
00332                     m_extensions[i]->copy_from(*other.m_extensions[i]);
00333                 }
00334             }
00335         }
00336     }
00337 
00338     // Free all extensions. Useful when reusing a cloned transaction that doesn't have memory manager.
00339     // normal and sticky extensions are freed and extension array cleared.
00340     void free_all_extensions()
00341     {
00342         m_extensions.free_entire_cache();
00343         for(unsigned int i=0; i<m_extensions.size(); i++)
00344         {
00345             if(m_extensions[i])
00346             {
00347                 m_extensions[i]->free();
00348                 m_extensions[i] = 0;
00349             }
00350         }
00351     }
00352     //--------------
00353     // Destructor
00354     //--------------
00355     virtual ~tlm_generic_payload() {
00356         for(unsigned int i=0; i<m_extensions.size(); i++)
00357             if(m_extensions[i]) m_extensions[i]->free();
00358     }
00359

00362     //---------------

00364     // Command related method
00365     bool                 is_read() const {return (m_command == TLM_READ_COMMAND);}
00366     void                 set_read() {m_command = TLM_READ_COMMAND;}
00367     bool                 is_write() const {return (m_command == TLM_WRITE_COMMAND);}
00368     void                 set_write() {m_command = TLM_WRITE_COMMAND;}
00369     tlm_command          get_command() const {return m_command;}
00370     void                 set_command(const tlm_command command) {m_command = command;}
00371 
00372     // Address related methods
00373     sc_dt::uint64        get_address() const {return m_address;}
00374     void                 set_address(const sc_dt::uint64 address) {m_address = address;}
00375 
00376     // Data related methods
00377     unsigned char*       get_data_ptr() const {return m_data;}
00378     void                 set_data_ptr(unsigned char* data) {m_data = data;}
00379 
00380     // Transaction length (in bytes) related methods
00381     unsigned int         get_data_length() const {return m_length;}
00382     void                 set_data_length(const unsigned int length) {m_length = length;}
00383 
00384     // Response status related methods
00385     bool                 is_response_ok() const {return (m_response_status > 0);}
00386     bool                 is_response_error() const {return (m_response_status <= 0);}
00387     tlm_response_status  get_response_status() const {return m_response_status;}
00388     void                 set_response_status(const tlm_response_status response_status)
00389         {m_response_status = response_status;}
00390     std::string          get_response_string() const
00391     {
00392         switch(m_response_status)
00393         {
00394         case TLM_OK_RESPONSE:            return "TLM_OK_RESPONSE";
00395         case TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESPONSE:    return "TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESPONSE";
00396         case TLM_GENERIC_ERROR_RESPONSE: return "TLM_GENERIC_ERROR_RESPONSE";
00397         case TLM_ADDRESS_ERROR_RESPONSE: return "TLM_ADDRESS_ERROR_RESPONSE";
00398         case TLM_COMMAND_ERROR_RESPONSE: return "TLM_COMMAND_ERROR_RESPONSE";
00399         case TLM_BURST_ERROR_RESPONSE:   return "TLM_BURST_ERROR_RESPONSE";
00400         case TLM_BYTE_ENABLE_ERROR_RESPONSE: return "TLM_BYTE_ENABLE_ERROR_RESPONSE";
00401         }
00402         return "TLM_UNKNOWN_RESPONSE";
00403     }
00404 
00405     // Streaming related methods
00406     unsigned int         get_streaming_width() const {return m_streaming_width;}
00407     void                 set_streaming_width(const unsigned int streaming_width) {m_streaming_width = streaming_width; }
00408 
00409     // Byte enable related methods
00410     unsigned char*       get_byte_enable_ptr() const {return m_byte_enable;}
00411     void                 set_byte_enable_ptr(unsigned char* byte_enable){m_byte_enable = byte_enable;}
00412     unsigned int         get_byte_enable_length() const {return m_byte_enable_length;}
00413     void                 set_byte_enable_length(const unsigned int byte_enable_length){m_byte_enable_length = byte_enable_length;}
00414 
00415     // This is the "DMI-hint" a slave can set this to true if it
00416     // wants to indicate that a DMI request would be supported:
00417     void                 set_dmi_allowed(bool dmi_allowed) { m_dmi = dmi_allowed; }
00418     bool                 is_dmi_allowed() const { return m_dmi; }
00419 
00420 private:
00421 
00422     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00423     /* Generic Payload attributes:                                           */
00424     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00425     /* - m_command         : Type of transaction. Three values supported:    */
00426     /*                       - TLM_WRITE_COMMAND                             */
00427     /*                       - TLM_READ_COMMAND                              */
00428     /*                       - TLM_IGNORE_COMMAND                            */
00429     /* - m_address         : Transaction base address (byte-addressing).     */
00430     /* - m_data            : When m_command = TLM_WRITE_COMMAND contains a   */
00431     /*                       pointer to the data to be written in the target.*/
00432     /*                       When m_command = TLM_READ_COMMAND contains a    */
00433     /*                       pointer where to copy the data read from the    */
00434     /*                       target.                                         */
00435     /* - m_length          : Total number of bytes of the transaction.       */
00436     /* - m_response_status : This attribute indicates whether an error has   */
00437     /*                       occurred during the transaction.                */
00438     /*                       Values supported are:                           */
00439     /*                       - TLM_OK_RESP                                   */
00440     /*                       - TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESP                           */
00441     /*                       - TLM_GENERIC_ERROR_RESP                        */
00442     /*                       - TLM_ADDRESS_ERROR_RESP                        */
00443     /*                       - TLM_COMMAND_ERROR_RESP                        */
00444     /*                       - TLM_BURST_ERROR_RESP                          */
00445     /*                       - TLM_BYTE_ENABLE_ERROR_RESP                    */
00446     /*                                                                       */
00447     /* - m_byte_enable     : It can be used to create burst transfers where  */
00448     /*                    the address increment between each beat is greater */
00449     /*                    than the word length of each beat, or to place     */
00450     /*                    words in selected byte lanes of a bus.             */
00451     /* - m_byte_enable_length : For a read or a write command, the target    */
00452     /*                    interpret the byte enable length attribute as the  */
00453     /*                    number of elements in the bytes enable array.      */
00454     /* - m_streaming_width  :                                                */
00455     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00456 
00457     sc_dt::uint64        m_address;
00458     tlm_command          m_command;
00459     unsigned char*       m_data;
00460     unsigned int         m_length;
00461     tlm_response_status  m_response_status;
00462     bool                 m_dmi;
00463     unsigned char*       m_byte_enable;
00464     unsigned int         m_byte_enable_length;
00465     unsigned int         m_streaming_width;
00466 
00467 public:
00468 
00469     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00470     /* Dynamic extension mechanism:                                          */
00471     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00472     /* The extension mechanism is intended to enable initiator modules to    */
00473     /* optionally and transparently add data fields to the                   */
00474     /* tlm_generic_payload. Target modules are free to check for extensions  */
00475     /* and may or may not react to the data in the extension fields. The     */
00476     /* definition of the extensions' semantics is solely in the              */
00477     /* responsibility of the user.                                           */
00478     /*                                                                       */
00479     /* The following rules apply:                                            */
00480     /*                                                                       */
00481     /* - Every extension class must be derived from tlm_extension, e.g.:     */
00482     /*     class my_extension : public tlm_extension<my_extension> { ... }   */
00483     /*                                                                       */
00484     /* - A tlm_generic_payload object should be constructed after C++        */
00485     /*   static initialization time. This way it is guaranteed that the      */
00486     /*   extension array is of sufficient size to hold all possible          */
00487     /*   extensions. Alternatively, the initiator module can enforce a valid */
00488     /*   extension array size by calling the resize_extensions() method      */
00489     /*   once before the first transaction with the payload object is        */
00490     /*   initiated.                                                          */
00491     /*                                                                       */
00492     /* - Initiators should use the the set_extension(e) or clear_extension(e)*/
00493     /*   methods for manipulating the extension array. The type of the       */
00494     /*   argument must be a pointer to the specific registered extension     */
00495     /*   type (my_extension in the above example) and is used to             */
00496     /*   automatically locate the appropriate index in the array.            */
00497     /*                                                                       */
00498     /* - Targets can check for a specific extension by calling               */
00499     /*   get_extension(e). e will point to zero if the extension is not      */
00500     /*   present.                                                            */
00501     /*                                                                       */
00502     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00503 
00504     // Stick the pointer to an extension into the vector, return the
00505     // previous value:
00506     template <typename T> T* set_extension(T* ext)
00507     {
00508         return static_cast<T*>(set_extension(T::ID, ext));
00509     }
00510 
00511     // non-templatized version with manual index:
00512     tlm_extension_base* set_extension(unsigned int index,
00513                                       tlm_extension_base* ext)
00514     {
00515         tlm_extension_base* tmp = m_extensions[index];
00516         m_extensions[index] = ext;
00517         return tmp;
00518     }
00519 
00520     // Stick the pointer to an extension into the vector, return the
00521     // previous value and schedule its release
00522     template <typename T> T* set_auto_extension(T* ext)
00523     {
00524         return static_cast<T*>(set_auto_extension(T::ID, ext));
00525     }
00526 
00527     // non-templatized version with manual index:
00528     tlm_extension_base* set_auto_extension(unsigned int index,
00529                                            tlm_extension_base* ext)
00530     {
00531         tlm_extension_base* tmp = m_extensions[index];
00532         m_extensions[index] = ext;
00533         if (!tmp) m_extensions.insert_in_cache(&m_extensions[index]);
00534         assert(m_mm != 0);
00535         return tmp;
00536     }
00537 
00538     // Check for an extension, ext will point to 0 if not present
00539     template <typename T> void get_extension(T*& ext) const
00540     {
00541         ext = get_extension<T>();
00542     }
00543     template <typename T> T* get_extension() const
00544     {
00545         return static_cast<T*>(get_extension(T::ID));
00546     }
00547     // Non-templatized version with manual index:
00548     tlm_extension_base* get_extension(unsigned int index) const
00549     {
00550         return m_extensions[index];
00551     }
00552 
00553     //this call just removes the extension from the txn but does not
00554     // call free() or tells the MM to do so
00555     // it return false if there was active MM so you are now in an unsafe situation
00556     // recommended use: when 100% sure there is no MM
00557     template <typename T> void clear_extension(const T* ext)
00558     {
00559         clear_extension<T>();
00560     }
00561 
00562     //this call just removes the extension from the txn but does not
00563     // call free() or tells the MM to do so
00564     // it return false if there was active MM so you are now in an unsafe situation
00565     // recommended use: when 100% sure there is no MM
00566     template <typename T> void clear_extension()
00567     {
00568         clear_extension(T::ID);
00569     }
00570 
00571     //this call removes the extension from the txn and does
00572     // call free() or tells the MM to do so when the txn is finally done
00573     // recommended use: when not sure there is no MM
00574     template <typename T> void release_extension(T* ext)
00575     {
00576         release_extension<T>();
00577     }
00578 
00579     //this call removes the extension from the txn and does
00580     // call free() or tells the MM to do so when the txn is finally done
00581     // recommended use: when not sure there is no MM
00582     template <typename T> void release_extension()
00583     {
00584         release_extension(T::ID);
00585     }
00586 
00587 private:
00588     // Non-templatized version with manual index
00589     void clear_extension(unsigned int index)
00590     {
00591         m_extensions[index] = static_cast<tlm_extension_base*>(0);
00592     }
00593     // Non-templatized version with manual index
00594     void release_extension(unsigned int index)
00595     {
00596         if (m_mm)
00597         {
00598             m_extensions.insert_in_cache(&m_extensions[index]);
00599         }
00600         else
00601         {
00602             m_extensions[index]->free();
00603             m_extensions[index] = static_cast<tlm_extension_base*>(0);
00604         }
00605     }
00606 
00607 public:
00608     // Make sure the extension array is large enough. Can be called once by
00609     // an initiator module (before issuing the first transaction) to make
00610     // sure that the extension array is of correct size. This is only needed
00611     // if the initiator cannot guarantee that the generic payload object is
00612     // allocated after C++ static construction time.
00613     void resize_extensions()
00614     {
00615         m_extensions.expand(max_num_extensions());
00616     }
00617 
00618 private:
00619     tlm_array<tlm_extension_base*> m_extensions;
00620     tlm_mm_interface*              m_mm;
00621     unsigned int                   m_ref_count;
00622 };
00623 
00624 } // namespace tlm
00625 
00626 #endif /* __TLM_GP_H__ */
